vmassol - (10:10): sburjan: indeed not nice  
evalica - (10:12): vmassol: I will start making the logo changes for the IE6  
vmassol - (10:13): evalica: ok thanks  
sburjan - (10:18): vmassol: another one reported on the incubator page (js error when creating a page)  
vmassol - (10:18): sburjan: please report them in jira  
sburjan - (10:19): I'm testing on snapshot  
sburjan - (10:19): I know only releases are to be reported in jira  
\_\_mel\_\_ joined #xwiki at 10:21  
vmassol - (10:21): sburjan: btw you seem to be using an oldish one  
vmassol - (10:21): since I can see this commit:  
vmassol - (10:21): -XWiki.hasBackupPackImportRights = $xwiki.package.hasBackupPackImportRights();  
vmassol - (10:21): +XWiki.hasBackupPackImportRights =#if ($xwiki.package) $xwiki.package.hasBackupPackImportRights()#else false#end;  
vmassol - (10:21): ah maybe not  
vmassol - (10:21): it's been evaluated probbaly in your screenshot  
sburjan - (10:22): let me check  
vmassol - (10:22): so it's indeed still a pb  
vmassol - (10:22): sburjan: you can report against XWIKI-5724  
sburjan - (10:22): vmassol: 11-Dec-2010 17:46  110M   this is the snapshot I'm using  
sburjan - (10:22): I will download the latest  
sburjan - (10:22): and start voer  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:22): good morning. i have a problem on enabling more than one syntax. the dropdown box "Page Syntax"  only shows Xwikit 1.0. but i have configured xwiki 2.0 and confluence. Version is 2.5.1  
sburjan - (10:22): over  
vmassol - (10:23): \_\_mel\_\_: what does your xwiki.cfg says ?  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:23  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:23): its this line: xwiki.rendering.syntaxes = xwiki/2.0, confluence/1.0  
vmassol - (10:23): \_\_mel\_\_: also you need to be sure to have the correct version of DocumentInformationPanel  
vmassol - (10:24): you probbaly have an old one  
vmassol - (10:24): is this an upgrade?  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:24): yes, its an update from an earlier version  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:25): where do i get the version from the DocumentInformationPanel?  
vmassol - (10:25): \_\_mel\_\_: so attach the latest XAR in the admin import section and import that page  
vmassol - (10:25): \_\_mel\_\_: you need to refresh the default pages when you upgrade  
vmassol - (10:25): you can check the upgrade instructions here:  
vmassol - (10:26): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HUpgradinganXWikiInstallation  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:26): i have upgraded Application Manager, Wiki Manager and so on  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:27): Is it the panles application that i need?  
vmassol - (10:29): \_\_mel\_\_: yes  
vmassol - (10:29): but it's included in the default XAR  
vmassol - (10:29): (in the Panels space)  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:30): can i see the version in the Applications Manger?  
sburjan - (10:33): vmassol: so the first bug doesn't appear anymore on the latest snapshot. but the second still does  
vmassol - (10:34): \_\_mel\_\_: nope the app manager is not used for that I think.  
silviar joined #xwiki at 10:34  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:34): I'm not sure if i did the update.  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:35): this is the package xwiki-enterprise-wiki, right?  
vmassol - (10:36): yes  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:36): i had downloaded xwiki-enterprise-web-2.5.1.war and xwiki-enterprise-wiki-2.5.1.xar  
\_\_mel\_\_ - (10:38): ok. another question. do i have to upgrade all wikis i an farm or just the farm-manger?

sburjan - (13:12): guys  
sburjan - (13:12): 2010-12-14 14:12:32,542 [http://192.168.2.11:8080/xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?xredirect=http%3A%2F%2F192.168.2.11%3A8080%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FIE7Space%2FIE7Page] WARN  internal.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Deprecated usage of method [com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki.parseMessage] in /templates/login.vm@28,33  
sburjan - (13:13): I get this when logging. The login works, but it seems to use some deprecated stuff... shouldn't we replace with the new api ?  
sburjan - (13:25): ultra funny bug on IE7 : http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/27snapshots  
lucaa left at 13:36 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds

jstoldt - (13:48): hi folks  
sburjan - (13:56): vmassol: ping. It seems that on IE 7, the LiveTable from extensions doesn't work.  
sburjan - (13:57): not even when searching for names .. it filters, it finds but it doesn't display at all  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 14:04  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:07  
sdumitriu - (14:09): Branching 2.7  
tmortagne - (14:10): sdumitriu: need to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5786 before you release  
sburjan - (14:10): sdumitriu: before the release, check the URL from above, because I posted some screenshots on what I've found so far  
sdumitriu - (14:10): tmortagne: OK, ping me when ready  
tmortagne - (14:10): i will take care of that since i think jvelociter can't today  
tmortagne - (14:10): should not take long  
sburjan - (14:17): also found office importer server start error  
sburjan - (14:17): it does start, but with console error  
lucaa left at 14:20 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:21  
sdumitriu left at 14:21 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
mbryant joined #xwiki at 14:22  
sburjan - (14:24): jstoldt: check the text around the second picture. :)  
sburjan - (14:24): the image breaks the syntax  
jstoldt - (14:25): huh=  
jstoldt - (14:25): ?  
jstoldt - (14:25): what exactly breaks?  
jstoldt - (14:25): i don't get it...  
sburjan - (14:26): In wiki code the macro is something like {{windowsPath share="~"V:MicrosoftOfficeOffice 2007 Compatibility PackFileFormatC  
sburjan - (14:26): check that line  
jstoldt - (14:26): yeah, what about it?  
sburjan - (14:27): and check exactly below the image  
sburjan - (14:27): doesn't look good  
jstoldt - (14:27): well, look at the previous revision  
jstoldt - (14:27): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/Extension/Windows+Path+Macro?rev=13.1  
jstoldt - (14:28): i don't think a broken picture is any better... i just fixed the broken image  
jstoldt - (14:28): i know the information is dupe...  
sburjan - (14:28): yes, but now the text is broken :)  
sburjan - (14:28): before and after the image, instad to be all in one place  
sburjan - (14:28): \*instead  
sburjan - (14:29): unlock the page so I can fix  
jstoldt - (14:29): nothing looks broken here on Opera 10.63  
sburjan - (14:30): fixed  
jstoldt - (14:32): you only added a space and it changed nothing... O\_O  
jstoldt - (14:32): i really have no clue what this was about...  
sburjan - (14:33): it seems only FF is affected  
sburjan - (14:33): it had code - image - code  
sburjan - (14:33): this is the order I got displayed  
sburjan - (14:33): so the picture was actually breaking the code  
jstoldt - (14:33): yeah, that's what i don't like about browsers that don't obey the standards...  
sburjan - (14:33): I added a new line and it fixed  
jstoldt - (14:33): yeah  
sburjan - (14:34): on what version was the screenshot taken ?  
jstoldt - (14:36): i dunno  
jstoldt - (14:36): i just tried to fix the image and not actually change the content  
sburjan - (14:36): oh i see  
sburjan - (14:36): I though you re-created the screenshot  
jstoldt - (14:36): nope, it was there all along  
jstoldt - (14:37): i think it's outdated  
jstoldt - (14:38): the version i installed gives me code like this: {{windowsPath share="V:\Zertifikate\pdf\VDE-Normen\DIN EN 60898-1.pdf" name="V: Laufwerk"/}}  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:38  
sburjan - (14:39): It's outdaed for sure just by looking at the top menu... which is changed since 2.5  
sburjan - (14:39): if you can re-create it using a newer version (if you have one) and adding 1px black borders it would be awesome :)  
jstoldt - (14:40): okay, will do in a minute  
jstoldt - (14:40): first need to make use of it first ;)  
sburjan - (14:42): yepp .. :)  
lucaa left at 14:46 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sdumitriu - (14:46): vmassol: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-core-rendering-tests/6678/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.rendering.scaffolding/RenderingTestCase/simple\_encoding\_encoding1\_test\_\_xhtml\_1\_0\_\_xhtml\_1\_0\_/  
sdumitriu - (14:47): The new xml printer doesn't encode non-ASCII characters anymore  
sdumitriu - (14:47): So the test should be changed  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:47  
sdumitriu - (14:48): There are 3 options:  
sdumitriu - (14:48): 1. Remove the test, since it's no longer relevant  
sdumitriu - (14:48): 2. Change the test using UTF-8 characters ˜€  
sdumitriu - (14:48): 3. Change the test using Unicode Java Escapes \u02DC  
sdumitriu - (14:49): 2 is the simplest but it breaks our guideline not to use non-ASCII characters in source files  
sdumitriu - (14:49): 3 needs to change the way we read the input, to use buffer.append(StringEscapeUtils.unescapeJava(line)).append('\n');  
sdumitriu - (14:50): And this breaks all the other tests, which will have to be updated, but it ensures that we can have non-ASCII chars in our test inputs  
sdumitriu - (14:50): WDYT, vmassol?  
sdumitriu - (14:50): tmortagne: WDYT?  
sdumitriu - (14:51): tmortagne: This failed as well: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-core-extension-handler-jar/6678/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.extension.repository/DefaultExtensionManagerTest/testInstallAndUninstallExtension/  
tmortagne - (14:52): sdumitriu: not sure  
tmortagne - (14:52): I don't like 1. for sure  
tmortagne - (14:53): 2. will be quickly broken  
tmortagne - (14:54): 3. we need support for escaping in rendeing tests anyway IMO  
vmassol - (14:54): escaping?  
sdumitriu - (14:54): So should I use StringEscapeUtils.unescapeJava?  
tmortagne - (14:55): not sure for which syntax to use but java one is well known, i trust you on that  
tmortagne - (14:55): vmassol: "(14:48:45) sdumitriu: 3. Change the test using Unicode Java Escapes \u02DC"  
vmassol - (14:56): well we need to be as close to user inputs as possible  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 14:56  
tmortagne - (14:56): sure but we can't really put UTF-8 characters  
sburjan - (14:57): sdumitriu: if I want to report an Improvement for User Preferences page (Change Password feature) ... where should I report this ?  
sburjan - (14:57): on XE Project ?  
vmassol - (14:57): we already have a notation for the expect parts, we should use the same notation but it's not good enough for inputs: (((8364)))  
sdumitriu - (14:57): sburjan: Yes, XE  
tmortagne - (14:57): sdumitriu: i'm done with XWIKI-5786, double checking before comiting  
vmassol - (14:58): sdumitriu: I'm not sure I like that ˜€ are changed  
sdumitriu - (14:59): WDYM changed?  
vmassol - (14:59): sdumitriu: "The new xml printer". What new xml printer?  
sdumitriu - (15:00): They were already changed, ˜ -> ˜  
sdumitriu - (15:00): We can't preserve the exact entity right now  
sdumitriu - (15:00): Not unless we introduce entities in XDOM  
cjdelisle` left at 15:01 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sdumitriu - (15:01): (((8364))) doesn't work in the "expect|xhtml" part  
jbrBridge left at 15:01 (Ping timeout: 264 seconds  
vmassol - (15:01): yep, it's only used for printing in the events renderer  
vmassol - (15:02): "Not unless we introduce entities in XDOM"  
vmassol - (15:02): I don't understand that part  
sdumitriu - (15:02): There's option 4 also, skip the test for this release while we continue debating  
vmassol - (15:02): it's easy for an xhtml renderer to recognize entities if we wanted  
sdumitriu - (15:03): The renderer only looks in XDOM  
vmassol - (15:03): yes and the char is in the xdom  
sdumitriu - (15:03): How can it recognize something that's not in XDOM?  
vmassol - (15:03): sdumitriu: I don't have any general opinion on this, I haven't followed the dsicussion about the "new xml printer"  
tmortagne - (15:03): why are you talking about the XDOM ? having the entities in the XDOM doe snot make any sense  
tmortagne - (15:04): the entity is a representation of the char in some XML syntax  
sburjan - (15:04): XE-789  
sdumitriu - (15:04): The char yes, but you don't know if the char came from ˜, ˜, ˜. ˜, ˜ or just from ˜  
tmortagne - (15:04): sdumitriu: you don't care  
sdumitriu - (15:04): I know  
sdumitriu - (15:05): vmassol was complaining that ˜ is changed  
tmortagne - (15:05): ho ok missed that part  
sdumitriu - (15:05): We can not not change it unless we know it was ˜  
vmassol - (15:05): no but we could decide to always output @tilde;  
vmassol - (15:05): oops  
vmassol - (15:05): ˜  
tmortagne - (15:05): all we can do is using the most standard one in the renderer (like for lots of other things)  
vmassol - (15:06): anyway, I don't have any opinion except that the tests seems useful to me  
vmassol - (15:06): I hope this "new xml printer" doesn't break other stuff  
sdumitriu - (15:06): XWIKI-5763  
sdumitriu - (15:07): I'm -0.8 on always printing escapes  
tmortagne - (15:07): XWIKI-5763 seems a bit dangerous to me  
tmortagne - (15:07): what happen when you are configured as ISO ?  
sdumitriu - (15:07): UTF-8 is supposed to make escapes useless  
vmassol - (15:07): tmortagne: yes htat's my worry too  
tmortagne - (15:07): which is why we set escaping at first  
tmortagne - (15:08): to upport any output encoding  
sdumitriu - (15:08): But it still doesn't work  
tmortagne - (15:08): s/upport/support/  
tmortagne - (15:08): why ?  
sdumitriu - (15:09): any includes UTF-16 and CJK and the other encodings which won't work if we output bytes  
vmassol - (15:09): &#xxxx; always work no?  
sdumitriu - (15:09): Right now it doesn't anyway  
vmassol - (15:10): (independently of the system encoding)  
sdumitriu - (15:10): If you try to input this kind of chars they will be transformed to &#xyz; on the clientside, without the {{html}} macro, so it will be broken content anyway  
tmortagne - (15:10): sdumitriu: I don't know for fancy encoding like UTF-16, but what will happen when we will upgrade xwiki.org to 2.7 ?  
sdumitriu - (15:12): This is why we have http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/444307267  
vmassol - (15:12): I'm not sure  
sdumitriu - (15:12): So your question actually is: won't characters that can't actually be placed in the content be displayed wrong?  
vmassol - (15:13): browsers should output &#xxxx; correctly no?  
sdumitriu - (15:13): They should  
sdumitriu - (15:13): But we don't allow &# outside {{html}}  
vmassol - (15:13): yes but that's different  
tmortagne - (15:13): sdumitriu: my question is xwiki.org is sending xml with "<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?> " which will contains UTF-8 characters which seesm very bad to me  
sdumitriu - (15:13): So we can't have those chars in the source to begin with  
sdumitriu - (15:13): tmortagne: No  
vmassol - (15:13): we're tzalking about the xhtml renderer here  
sdumitriu - (15:13): That's different  
sdumitriu - (15:14): My change was:  
sdumitriu - (15:14): before: ALWAYS escape non-ASCII chars  
sdumitriu - (15:14): after: Escape as needed by the current encoding  
sdumitriu - (15:14): At least I think so  
sburjan - (15:14): afaik we wanted UTF-8 to support multiple languages  
tmortagne - (15:15): sdumitriu: i don't think so, now it's using the system encoding which is not XWiki encoding  
sdumitriu - (15:15): Who is?  
tmortagne - (15:15): XML writer  
sdumitriu - (15:15): Well, that's bad  
tmortagne - (15:16): i'm not sure but i don't see where xwiki encoding is set  
tmortagne - (15:19): the renderer is in rendering module and has no idea what is XWiki endoing  
tmortagne - (15:19): encoding  
tmortagne - (15:23): the only clean way to support that IMO would be to use a render that send SAX events instead of printing a String (like in the XML+XDOM renderer), that way XWiki provide the XML writer configured for its own needs  
tmortagne - (15:29): sdumitriu: forgot some refactoring for XWIKI-5786, i'm on it  
sabageru - (15:37): hi guys. one question about xwiki.org and AS. How many events are we talking about ? Meaning how many events do we have recorded on xwiki.org ?  
sburjan - (15:38): vmassol: reminder : extensions.xwiki.org LiveTable doesn't work on IE7  
vmassol - (15:38): sburjan: tell me what I need to do about it  
jstoldt - (15:39): how would i go about adding a checkbox (bool) parameter to a wiki macro?  
vmassol - (15:39): sabageru: no idea but if you give me the velocity script to query the table I can run it (since I have PR)  
tmortagne - (15:40): jstoldt: wiki macros don't support typed parameters yet  
jstoldt - (15:40): ah, too bad  
sburjan - (15:40): vmassol: unfortunately I don;t know :(  
jstoldt - (15:40): well, will have to do it with a string then. thank  
jstoldt - (15:40): s  
vmassol - (15:41): sburjan: AFAIK there' nothing special on that page so it means all Livetable don't work with IE7  
vmassol - (15:41): and if that's the case it should logged in jira  
mbryant - (15:42): hey guys quick question, does the date time format for an objects properties support a full ISO 8601 format?  
jstoldt - (15:44): hmmm is it possible to reuse descriptions available for other parts of XWiki in a Wiki macros? namely, i want to add a tooltip to the Windows Path Macro and want to reuse the same string available in WYSIWYG editor  
jstoldt - (15:44): any chance of achieving this?  
sburjan - (15:45): vmassol: tested on 2.6 final and LiveTable Works. Maybe it's something related to tags.  
vmassol - (15:46): sburjan: you have a screenshot of what doesn't work? Have you tried the tag cloud on 2.6 with IE7?  
tmortagne - (15:46): jstoldt: i don't think so, macro description are strongly linked to the macro, either plain string a a field or a translation for not way to make it look like elsewhere dynamically AFAIK  
tmortagne - (15:47): s/for not/but no/  
sburjan - (15:47): vmassol: uploading screenshot  
jstoldt - (15:47): pitty but okay, i'll just C&P the strings from the language file then...  
tmortagne - (15:48): we plan to support variables in translations at some point but it's not top of the todo list  
jstoldt - (15:48): cool :)  
sburjan - (15:50): vmassol: http://img121.imageshack.us/i/extensionslivetable.png/  
sburjan - (15:50): Tag Cloud works on 2.6 with IE 7  
vmassol - (15:52): sburjan: seems you've clicked on the tag cloud in the screenshot  
vmassol - (15:52): can you try without clicking in the tag?  
vmassol - (15:53): the image looks ok, it simply shows no match  
vmassol - (15:53): ah not quite 1-30 of 30  
sburjan - (15:53): vmassol: I didn't click on the tag cloud. I just selected Type -> Plugin  
vmassol - (15:54): anyway I'm not the right person to help here  
vmassol - (15:54): IMO this needs to be raised in jira
